com.roscopeco.ormdroid

Class TypeMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.roscopeco.ormdroid.TypeMapper

  • public final class TypeMapper
extends java.lang.Object

    Supports mappings between Java types and their SQL representations.

    By default, ORMDroid provides a mapping for all primitive types and Entity classes. All other types are mapped by the default mapping (if configured with setDefaultMapping(TypeMapping)). By default, there is no default mapping - attempting to use a model class with a field of an unmapped type will throw an exception.

    Custom types may be mapped by registering an instance of TypeMapping via the mapType method. The default mapping can also be overriden using the setDefaultMapping method.

    Mappings are made based on assignability. When searching for a mapping for a given type, this class will return the most recently added mapping with a type that is assignable from the type being searched for.

    Any custom mappings should be registered before any database operations are performed. If mappings are changed when schemas already exist in the database, errors are very likely to result.

      • encodeValue

        public static java.lang.String encodeValue(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        Shortcut to the TypeMapping.encodeValue(SQLiteDatabase, Object) method for the given value.
        Parameters:
        db - The SQLiteDatabase instance to use.
        value - The value to encode.
        Returns:

      • mapType

        public static void mapType(TypeMapping mapping)
        Add the specified mapping to the mapping list. New items are added at the front of the list, allowing remapping of already-mapped types.

      • setDefaultMapping

        public static void setDefaultMapping(TypeMapping mapping)
        Override the default mapping. This is used when no mapping is configured for a given type.
        Parameters:
        mapping - The TypeMapping to use by default.
